alert.note: Alert for Borden; Glasscock; Howard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 02 at 5:59PM CDT until June 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... North central Glasscock County in western Texas... Southeastern Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 559 PM CDT, a dust channel was near Big Spring, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 165 and 196. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Luther, J B Thomas Reservoir, Big Spring Country Club, Vincent, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark and Elbow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
